I believe you could do it with an _if-script_ and a _variable_. But I could be mistaken. On the _Container Object, Attributes Tab_ ``` if (player.toobig=True) { msg ("
You simply cannot fit this into your bag! Argh, the humanity!
") } ``` And then on the _Specific Object, Attributes Tab_ ``` ADD toobig Boolean - True ``` Oops...too late! Well, this is an alternative anyway. Hope it works! Anonynn

Posts.EditableText: cheers anonynn! Have gone with the volume solution and a limited container, object value is zero by default, so set limit of 1 on container, then change volume = 1 on any object I don't want the player to fit in the container
